result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G Harding was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $300.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------------

Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
-------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   No violent contact with victim(s).
-------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations, which was completed prior to sentencing.
-------------------------------

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to complete a total of forty (40) hours of community service work during his period of probation WITH buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael G Harding

*AMENDMENT 3-20-2015 - NO CONTACT PROVISION WITH M.E. AND R.G. AND M.G. LIFTED.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.E., R.G.; OR M.G..  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
